## Load and clean the Covid data

```{r}
# File path on local drive
input_path <- c("C:/Users/ethan.walker/Box/Missoula_COVID19EpiProfile_Working/")

# Read in Excel file and format columns
covid_data_initial <- 
   read_xlsx(paste0(input_path, "COVID Data_04.11.2022.xlsx"), sheet = 1,
             range = "A2:P40000", na = c(" ", ""),
                        col_names = c("investigation_status", "inv_start_date", "health_worker", 
                                      "cong_living", "age", "age_unit",
                                      "sex", "zipcode", "test_date", "um_student", "race", 
                                      "ethnicity", "ever_hosp", "patient_died",
                                      "breakthrough_case", "reinfection_case"),
                        col_types = c("text", "date", "text",
                                      "text", "text", "text",
                                      "text", "text", "date", "text", "text",
                                      "text", "text", "text",
                                      "text", "text"))

#summary(covid_data_initial)
```


```{r}
# Clean data
covid_data <- covid_data_initial %>% 
   # Filter out empty rows/observations
   filter(!is.na(investigation_status)) %>% 
   # Format age and age groups with age group percentages
   mutate(age = as.numeric(age),
          age_group = cut(age, breaks = c(0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 130),
                          labels = c("0 to 9, 0.101", "10 to 19, 0.117", "20 to 29, 0.191", 
                                     "30 to 39, 0.143", "40 to 49, 0.115", "50 to 59, 0.112", 
                                     "60 to 69, 0.118", "70 to 79, 0.072", "80+, 0.032"), right = FALSE),
          age_group2 = cut(age, breaks = c(0, 18, 65, 130),
                          labels = c("<18", "18 to 64", "65+"), right = FALSE),
          age_group3 = cut(age, breaks = c(0, 5, 14, 18, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 130),
                          labels = c("0 to 4, 0.0503", "5 to 13, 0.095", "14 to 17, 0.0405", 
                                     "18 to 24, 0.137", "25 to 29, 0.086", 
                                     "30 to 39, 0.143", "40 to 49, 0.115", "50 to 59, 0.112", 
                                     "60 to 69, 0.118", "70 to 79, 0.072", "80+, 0.032"), right = FALSE)) %>% 
   # Separate age groups from percentages
   separate(age_group, c("age_group", "age_group_percent"), sep = ", ") %>% 
   separate(age_group3, c("age_group3", "age_group3_percent"), sep = ", ") %>% 
   mutate(age_group_percent = as.numeric(age_group_percent),
          age_group3_percent = as.numeric(age_group3_percent)) %>% 
   # Format character variables to factor and lower case
   mutate_if(is.factor, tolower) %>% 
   mutate_if(is.character, tolower) %>% 
   mutate_if(is.character, as.factor) %>% 
   # Consistently label NA values throughout dataset
   replace_with_na_all(condition = ~.x %in% c("n/a", "na", "unknown", "unkown")) %>% 
   # Excel had dates formatted as datetime, so separate into date and time
   separate(test_date, into = c("test_date", "time"), sep = " ") %>% 
   separate(inv_start_date, into = c("inv_start_date", "time2"), sep = " ") %>% 
   # Format specific variables
   mutate(county_pop = as.numeric(119600),
          case = 1,
          hospitalizations = fct_collapse(ever_hosp,
                                          "no" = c("n", NA),
                                          "yes" = c("y", "yes"),
                                          "unknown" = "unk"),
          reinfection_case = fct_collapse(reinfection_case,
                                          "no" = c("n"),
                                          "yes" = c("y"),
                                          "unknown" = "unk"),
          test_date = ymd(test_date),
          inv_start_date = ymd(inv_start_date),
          age_group3 = factor(age_group3,
                              levels = c("0 to 4", "5 to 13", "14 to 17", 
                                     "18 to 24", "25 to 29", 
                                     "30 to 39", "40 to 49", "50 to 59", 
                                     "60 to 69", "70 to 79", "80+"),
                              labels = c("0 to 4", "5 to 13", "14 to 17", 
                                     "18 to 24", "25 to 29", 
                                     "30 to 39", "40 to 49", "50 to 59", 
                                     "60 to 69", "70 to 79", "80+"))) %>% 
   select(-time, -time2, -ever_hosp)
   

summary(covid_data)
```


```{r}
# Save data as RDS if you want

write_rds(covid_data, paste0(file_path, "covid_data_clean.rds"))
```


## Covid analysis and figures using the cleaned data from above

```{r, include=FALSE, eval=FALSE}
# Check doubling time
inc_data <- covid_data %>% 
   rename(dates = test_date) %>% 
   filter(!is.na(dates)) %>% 
   filter(dates > Sys.Date() - 42 & dates < Sys.Date() - 14) %>% 
   arrange(dates) %>% 
   select(dates, case) %>% 
   group_by(dates) %>% 
   mutate(total_cases = sum(case, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
   arrange(dates) %>% 
   ungroup()

inc_data2 <- incidence(inc_data$dates)

plot(inc_data2)

inc_fit <- fit(inc_data2)
inc_fit
inc_fit$info$doubling # doubling time to report to D'Shane
#inc_fit$info$halving # halving time to report to D'Shane

#plot(inc_fit)

#find_peak(inc_data2)
```


```{r}
# Incidence data to use in figures below
age_incidence <- covid_data %>% 
   select(case, age_group, age_group_percent, county_pop) %>% 
   mutate(total_cases = n()) %>% 
   group_by(age_group) %>% 
   mutate(group_cases = n(),
          group_prop = group_cases/total_cases*100,
          group_pop = age_group_percent*county_pop,
          group_inc = group_cases/group_pop*100000) %>% 
   ungroup() %>% 
   distinct(age_group, .keep_all = TRUE) %>% 
   mutate(region = "Missoula County") %>% 
   select(region, age_group, group_cases, group_pop, group_inc, 
          county_pop, age_group_percent) %>% 
   filter(!is.na(age_group)) %>% 
   arrange(age_group)

age_incidence2 <- covid_data %>% 
   select(case, age_group3, age_group3_percent, county_pop) %>% 
   mutate(total_cases = n()) %>% 
   group_by(age_group3) %>% 
   mutate(group_cases = n(),
          group_prop = group_cases/total_cases*100,
          group_pop = age_group3_percent*county_pop,
          group_inc = group_cases/group_pop*100000) %>% 
   ungroup() %>% 
   distinct(age_group3, .keep_all = TRUE) %>% 
   mutate(region = "Missoula County") %>% 
   select(region, age_group3, group_cases, group_pop, group_inc, 
          county_pop, age_group3_percent) %>% 
   filter(!is.na(age_group3)) %>% 
   arrange(age_group3)
```

```{r}
# Save number of cases to use in figure below
age_n <- covid_data %>% 
   filter(!is.na(age_group))
age_cases <- sum(age_n$case)

# Age group bar plot - counts
age_count_plot <- covid_data %>% 
   filter(!is.na(age_group)) %>% 
   mutate(age_group = as.character(age_group),
          age_group = if_else(is.na(age_group), "Unknown", age_group),
          age_group = as.factor(age_group)) %>% 
   ggplot() +   
     geom_bar(aes(fct_rev(age_group)), fill = "steelblue", width = .6) +   
     labs(title = "COVID-19 Cases by age group",
          subtitle = paste0("Missoula County, since March 2020. N = ", age_cases, " cases."), 
          y = "Number of cases", x = "Age Group (years)") +
     scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(seq(0, 15000, 500)), labels = c(seq(0, 15000, 500))) +
     coord_flip() +
     theme_minimal() +
     theme(strip.text = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
           title = element_text(size = 18, colour = "black"),
           panel.grid = element_blank(),
           axis.text.x = element_text(size = 14, colour = "black", 
                                     angle = 45, vjust = 0.75, hjust = 0.9),
           legend.text = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
           legend.title = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
           axis.text.y = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
           axis.title.y = element_text(size = 14, colour = "black",
                                       margin = unit(c(0, 5, 0, 0), "mm")),
           axis.title.x = element_text(size = 14, colour = "black",
                                       margin = unit(c(5, 0, 0, 0), "mm")),
           axis.line.x = element_line(colour = "black", size = 1.2), 
           axis.line.y = element_line(colour = "black", size = 1.2), 
           axis.ticks = element_line(colour = "black"))
```

```{r}
# Save number of cases to use in figure below
age_n <- covid_data %>% 
   filter(!is.na(age_group) & !is.na(test_date)) %>% 
   filter(test_date > "2021-08-31")
age_cases <- sum(age_n$case)

# Age group line plot - counts by month
age_count_month_plot <- covid_data %>% 
   filter(test_date > "2021-08-31" & test_date < Sys.Date()) %>% 
   mutate(week_of_year = cut.Date(test_date, breaks = "1 week", start.on.monday = FALSE),
          week_of_year = ymd(week_of_year)) %>% 
   group_by(age_group, week_of_year) %>% 
   mutate(group_cases = n()) %>% 
   filter(!is.na(age_group)) %>% 
   filter(!is.na(week_of_year)) %>% 
   distinct(age_group, week_of_year, .keep_all = TRUE) %>% 
   ggplot() +
      geom_rect(aes(xmin = Sys.Date() - 21, xmax = Sys.Date(), ymin=0, ymax=Inf),
               fill = "gray80", alpha = 0.05) +
      geom_line(aes(week_of_year, group_cases, group = age_group, 
                    color = age_group), size = 1.5) +
      geom_label(aes(x = Sys.Date()-21, y = 275, 
                    label = "Cases from the shaded \n dates may not yet be \n reflected in the graph."),
                fill = NA) +
      theme_minimal() +
      labs(title = "Weekly COVID-19 cases by age group",
        subtitle = paste0("Missoula County, 2021. N = ", age_cases, " cases."),
        color = "Age group") +
      ylab("Number of cases per week") +
      xlab("") +
      scale_x_date(breaks = seq.Date(from = as.Date("2021-09-01"), 
                                    to = as.Date(Sys.Date()), 
                                    by = "7 days"),
                  labels = seq.Date(from = as.Date("2021-09-01"), 
                                    to = as.Date(Sys.Date()), 
                                    by = "7 days"),
                  date_labels = "%d-%b") +
      scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(seq(0, 500, 25)), labels = c(seq(0, 500, 25))) +
      theme(strip.text = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
         title = element_text(size = 18, colour = "black"),
         panel.grid = element_blank(),
         panel.grid.major.y = element_line(colour = "grey"),
         axis.text.x = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black", 
                                    angle = 90, vjust = 0.4),
         axis.text.y = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
         legend.text = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
         axis.title.y = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black",
                                     margin = unit(c(0, 5, 0, 0), "mm")),
         axis.title.x = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black",
                                     margin = unit(c(5, 0, 0, 0), "mm")),
         axis.line.x = element_blank(), 
         axis.line.y = element_blank(), 
         axis.ticks = element_blank()) +
   scale_color_manual(values = colorblind_palette)

age_count_month_plot

```

```{r}
## Missoula county Rt results using county data
case_data <- covid_data %>% 
   rename(dates = test_date) %>% 
   filter(!is.na(dates)) %>% 
   filter(dates > "2021-05-31" & dates < Sys.Date() - 13) %>% 
   arrange(dates) %>% 
   select(dates, case) %>% 
   arrange(dates) %>% 
   ungroup() 

latest_date <- format(Sys.Date() - 14, "%Y-%m-%d")

incidence_data <- incidence(case_data$dates, last_date = latest_date)

# Set dates for 14-day rolling averages
county_n <- as.data.frame(incidence_data$dates)
time_var <- nrow(county_n)
time_start <- seq(2, time_var-13)
time_end <- time_start + 13


# Serial Interval derived from State of Montana paired case data
serial_interval_mean <- 4.42
serial_interval_sd <- 3.51

r_results <- estimate_R(incidence_data, method="parametric_si", 
                           config = make_config(list(mean_si = serial_interval_mean, 
                                                     std_si = serial_interval_sd,
                                                     t_start =  time_start,
                                                     t_end = time_end)))

# Format and save analysis results
colomns <- c(1:4, 8)
county_r <- (r_results$R[,colomns]) %>% 
   mutate(region = "Missoula County") %>% 
   rename(mean_r = `Mean(R)`,
          sd_r = `Std(R)`,
          median_r = `Median(R)`)

county_dates <- as.data.frame(r_results$dates)
county_i <- as.data.frame(r_results$I)
county_cil <- as.data.frame(r_results$R$`Quantile.0.025(R)`)
county_cih <- as.data.frame(r_results$R$`Quantile.0.975(R)`)
county_dates_new <- cbind(county_dates, county_i) %>% 
   rename(dates = 1,
          incidence = 2) %>% 
   mutate(dates = ymd(dates))
county_dates_new <- county_dates_new[-(1:14), 1:2]
county_dates_new <- cbind(county_dates_new, county_cil, county_cih) %>% 
   rename(cl_low = 3,
          cl_high = 4)
county_r <- cbind(county_r, county_dates_new)


county_r_plot <- county_r %>% 
   filter(dates > "2021-05-31") %>% 
   ggplot() +
   geom_line(aes(dates, mean_r), size = 1.5, color = "black") +
   #geom_line(aes(dates, cl_low), size = 1.5, color = "grey") +
   #geom_line(aes(dates, cl_high), size = 1.5, color = "grey") +
   labs(title = "COVID-19 Rolling 14-day R-number, Missoula County",
        color = "") +
   ylab("R-number") +
   xlab("") +
   geom_hline(yintercept = 1, color = "red", size = 1.2) +
   scale_x_date(date_breaks = "7 days", date_labels = "%d-%b") +
   scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(0, 5, 0.05), labels = seq(0, 5, 0.05)) +
   theme_minimal() +
   theme(strip.text = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
         title = element_text(size = 18, colour = "black"),
         panel.grid = element_blank(),
         panel.grid.major.y = element_line(colour = "grey"),
         axis.text.x = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black", 
                                    angle = 90, vjust = 0.4),
         axis.text.y = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
         legend.text = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
         axis.title.y = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black",
                                     margin = unit(c(0, 5, 0, 0), "mm")),
         axis.title.x = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black",
                                     margin = unit(c(5, 0, 0, 0), "mm")),
         axis.line.x = element_blank(), 
         axis.line.y = element_blank(), 
         axis.ticks = element_blank()) +
   scale_color_manual(values = c("black"))
```

```{r, fig.width = 11, fig.height = 5}
incidence_plot_line <- covid_data %>% 
   filter(test_date > "2020-03-01" & test_date < Sys.Date()) %>% 
   mutate(week_of_year = cut.Date(test_date, breaks = "1 week", start.on.monday = FALSE),
          week_of_year = ymd(week_of_year)) %>% 
   select(case, hospitalizations, county_pop, week_of_year, test_date) %>% 
   mutate(hosp = as.numeric(hospitalizations) - 1) %>% 
   group_by(week_of_year) %>% 
   mutate(group_cases = n(),
          case_inc = group_cases/county_pop*100000,
          group_hosp = sum(hosp),
          hosp_inc = group_hosp/county_pop*100000,
          case_hosp_ratio = group_cases/group_hosp) %>% 
   ungroup() %>% 
   distinct(week_of_year, .keep_all = TRUE) %>% 
   mutate(region = "Missoula County") %>% 
   select(region, week_of_year, group_cases, case_inc, test_date, hosp,
          group_hosp, hosp_inc, county_pop, case_hosp_ratio) %>% 
   arrange(week_of_year) %>% 
   filter(!is.na(week_of_year)) %>% 
   ggplot() +
      geom_rect(aes(xmin = Sys.Date() - 21, xmax = Sys.Date(), ymin=0, ymax=Inf),
               fill = "gray80", alpha = 0.05) +
      geom_col(aes(week_of_year, case_inc), fill = "steelblue", size = 1.5) +

      theme_minimal() +

      geom_label(aes(x = Sys.Date()-40, y = 800,

      scale_x_date(breaks = seq.Date(from = as.Date("2020-03-06"),
```
